t: Lord,*spn hear my prayer, listen*ld to my cry for mercy; in*ln your faithfulness and righteousness come*ld to my relief.
Do*ln not bring your servant into judgment, for*ld no one living is righteous before you.
The*ln enemy pursues me, he*ld crushes me to the ground; he*ln makes me dwell in the darkness like*ld those long dead.
So*ln my spirit grows faint within me; my*ld heart within me is dismayed.
I*ln remember the days of long ago; I*ld meditate on all your works and*ld consider what your hands have done.
I*ln spread out my hands to you; I*ld thirst for you like a parched land.
Answer*pn me quickly, Lord;*s my*ld spirit fails. Do*ln not hide your face from me or*ld I will be like those who go down to the pit.
Let*ln the morning bring me word of your unfailing love, for*ld I have put my trust in you. Show*ln me the way I should go, for*ld to you I entrust my life.
Rescue*ln me from my enemies, Lord,*s for*ld I hide myself in you.
Teach*ln me to do your will, for*ld you are my God; may*ln your good Spirit lead*ld me on level ground.
For*pn your nameâ€™s sake, Lord,*s preserve my life; in*ld your righteousness, bring me out of trouble.
In*ln your unfailing love, silence my enemies; destroy*ld all my foes, for*ld I am your servant.
